place.name: Arroyo Quemado Transect 7
place.geographicDescription: Transect begins east of the river mouth. Bedrock with several large boulder outcrops creating some significant relief (0-2.5 m) along transect. Some moderate sized areas of sand (1-3 m) present along with Diopatra beds. Depth is approximately 25 feet.
place.completeDescription: Transect begins east of the river mouth. Bedrock with several large boulder outcrops creating some significant relief (0-2.5 m) along transect. Some moderate sized areas of sand (1-3 m) present along with Diopatra beds. Fluorescent Bumper at transect start. 40m stake lies just past, almost under a large (2m tall x 3m wide) boulder. All markers are yellow ½” rebar stakes about 30-60cm tall, some with tubing. Transect heading is 90-100 degrees.

verbatim.notesInfoReceived: Direction of transect is an average over entire transect
PAR sensor located at the 0m rebar from 1/2008 - 6/2010. Moved to transect 8.
130 PTCA; 80% rock; 5 small adult kelp plants; 65% urchin barren; large patches of DIOR; DIL and PGL common.
